casebody.data:
People ex rel. Grancher v. MacLean et al., Commissioners. (Superior Court of New York City,

General Term.

July 5, 1892.) Certiorari on the relation of Rudolph Grancher to review a finding and judgment of the board of police commissioners imposing upon the relator a fine of five days’ pay.

Argued before Freedman, Dugro, and Gildersleeve, JJ.

Louis J. Grant, for relator. Wm. H. Clark, for respondents. Per Curiam.

The evidence upon which the respondents proceeded was

sufficient to sustain their action. The writ should be dismissed, and the determination of the respondents affirmed, with $50 costs and disbursements.
